title: Nasdaq-Listed SKK Holdings Limited Had Appointed Chaince Securities as Strategic Advisor to Drive Tokenization Strategy - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Under this engagement, Chaince will advise SKK on structuring its digital asset treasury, capital market strategy, staking and validator node opportunities, and the development of strategic partnerships across the blockchain and Web3 ecosystem.
The collaboration reflects SKK’s forward-looking vision to integrate digital asset capabilities into its business model, enhancing capital efficiency and investor engagement.
As a Nasdaq-listed company with operations in Singapore, SKK is focused on specializes in subsurface utility works.
About SKK Holdings Ltd. SKK Holdings Limited is a civil engineering service provider that specializes in subsurface utility works in Singapore.
About Chaince Securities, LLC Chaince Securities, LLC (CRD #10590) is a FINRA-registered broker-dealer founded in 1982 and headquartered in New York City.

title: Why Your Treasury Bond Can't Talk To My Real Estate Token - Benzinga
summary:
We’re talking about real estate, Treasury bonds, commodities — actual, tangible assets — moving onto blockchain rails at a pace that would’ve seemed delusional five years ago.
Why Your Treasury Bond Can’t Talk to My Real Estate Token Let me give you a scenario that’s playing out right now in institutional portfolios.
That tokenized real estate offering 7% should be offering 5.5% in a connected market.
What we don’t have is the layer that lets them talk to each other, the SMTP of tokenized assets, if you will.
You’re not just exposed to the underlying asset, you’re exposed to the platform’s technology, team, regulatory standing, and liquidity provision.

title: Liquid Credit’s Woes Are Good for Private Lenders, Ares Says - Yahoo Finance
summary:
Recent failures in the credit markets, including First Brands Group and Tricolor Holdings, have fueled a frenzy around how much risk is sitting in private debt portfolios.
But for Ares Management Corp. executives, the losses actually make private credit look good, while presenting an opportunity to snag more deals.
“That’s a great time for private credit.” Issues for First Brands arose after the auto-part maker tried to refinance its debt in the broadly syndicated market, but failed to clinch a transaction and lenders requested a quality of earnings report.
Private credit firms are asking for a quality of earnings report for every new transaction, Schnabel said.
Investors have also been waiting for BDCs — a popular structure for direct lenders to pool their private credit loans — to report earnings and offer insight into the health of portfolios.

title: Robinhood's CEO Just Predicted Tokenization Will Eat The Whole Financial System—But Private Companies Aren't Ready For What Comes Next - Yahoo Finance
summary:
But getting there requires solving problems that have nothing to do with technology and everything to do with convincing skeptical private companies to embrace real-time price discovery.
Robinhood pursued being the first to tokenize shares of OpenAI and SpaceX, and is now working closely with private companies to ensure tokenization is welcomed rather than feared.
According to Tenev, customer demand is crystal clear—retail investors want private market access, and it’s poised to become a “big market.” But Tenev acknowledges the road ahead isn’t smooth.
“The tokenization of private companies is still quite early,” he said, pointing to significant hurdles with both regulators and the companies themselves.
The Private Company Problem: Why Real-Time Trading Scares Founders Here’s the tension at the heart of Tenev’s vision: some private companies “don’t like their stocks being traded in real time 24/7,” Tenev told CNBC.

summary:

Is this an early sign of trouble for semiliquid private credit funds?
The performance of listed BDCs, they may argue, therefore, has little relevance to their semiliquid funds, as each portfolio is supposedly unique.
These companies allocate many of the same deals to both their semiliquid funds and listed BDCs.
Otherwise, it points to the conclusion that semiliquid funds’ infrequent pricing is not a bug, but instead their main feature.

title: Gemcorp Joins Rush of Firms Eying Saudi Private Credit Market - Bloomberg
summary:
Emerging markets-focused asset manager Gemcorp Capital Management Ltd. sees major opportunities in Saudi Arabia’s nascent private credit market, joining Wall Street firms jockeying for deals in the kingdom.
Saudi Arabia’s strong growth and multibillion-dollar megaprojects are creating “unprecedented opportunities for private credit and flexible capital,” Chief Executive Officer Atanas Bostandjiev said in a Bloomberg TV interview.

title: Gemcorp Targets Saudi Arabia’s Private Credit Market - Bloomberg
summary:
Emerging markets-focused Gemcorp sees “unprecedented opportunities” in Saudi Arabia’s private credit market.
“There’s very good risk-reward here because the market is short on structural capital for private credit,” Chief Executive Officer Atanas Bostandjiev told Bloomberg's Horizons Middle East and Africa anchor Joumanna Bercetche.
(Source: Bloomberg)
